oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ocular Surgery for Squamous Cell Carcinoma
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hull, Bruce L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ocular carcinoma
squamous cell carcinoma
enucleation
exenteration
less radical therapy
immunotherapy
cryosurgery
radiofrequency hyperthermia
Beta radiation
surgical removal
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In treating ocular squamous cell carcinoma in cattle, certainly enucleation or exenteration have been the time honored methods of choice. In many cases they may still be the methods of choice, however, as they leave a unilaterally blind animal, other less radical methods of therapy should be used whenever possible. Less radical therapeutic approaches should include: 1) immunotherapy, 2) cryosurgery, 3) radiofrequency hyperthermia, 4) Beta radiation, and 5) surgical removal of the tumor tissue without complete enucleation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1989; 9-11
